AudioWorklet.summary: The AudioWorklet interface of the Web Audio API is used to supply custom audio processing scripts that execute in a separate thread to provide very low latency audio processing.

remarks.para: The worklet's code is run in the global execution context, using a separate Web Audio thread which is shared by the worklet and other audio nodes.
Access the audio context's instance of AudioWorklet through the property.

- — the global execution context of an AudioWorklet
-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API
-Using AudioWorklet

AudioWorkletPort.summary: NOTE Experimental The port read-only property of the interface returns a object that can be used to send and receive messages between the main thread and the associated .

remarks.para: This allows for custom, asynchronous communication between code in the main thread and the global scope of an audio worklet, such as receiving control data or global settings.

- — the global execution context of an AudioWorklet
-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API
-Using AudioWorklet

AudioWorkletPort.value: The object connecting the AudioWorklet and its associated AudioWorkletGlobalScope.
